bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

div1.head: Newspaper clipping, Washington Post, February, 1910
div1.p:
House Committee Is Disposed to Increase
the Amount.

The House Committee on Pensions evi-
denced a disposition yesterday morning
to increase the amount of the pension to
the widow of Maj. Walter Reed, U. S. A.
The Senate bill, which was passed last
week, provided for the sum of $125 a
month. As there was only a bare quo-
rum present, action in the direction of
increasing the amount could not be taken,
a two-thirds vote being necessary.

Some of the advocates of the bill are
disposed to prefer having the amount re-
main as fixed by the Senate, and thus
avoid having to make another fight in
the Senate over the bili in its amended
form. Senator Martin, of Virginia, the
patron of the bill, said yesterday that Dr.
Reed, by his discovery that yellow fever
is transmitted by mosquitoes, had saved
more lives than were lost in the Span-
ish war.
